com.biorecorder.edflib.base

Class DefaultEdfConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biorecorder.edflib.base.EdfConfig
      • com.biorecorder.edflib.base.DefaultEdfConfig
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HeaderConfig

    public class DefaultEdfConfig
extends EdfConfig

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultEdfConfig()
      Default constructor that creates a DefaultEdfConfig instance with 0 channels (signals).

      Constructor to make a copy of the given DefaultEdfConfig instance
      DefaultEdfConfig(int numberOfSignals)
      This constructor creates a DefaultEdfConfig instance of the given type (EDF_16BIT or BDF_24BIT) with the given number of channels (signals)

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultEdfConfig

        public DefaultEdfConfig()
        Default constructor that creates a DefaultEdfConfig instance with 0 channels (signals). So all channels should be added as necessary.

        See method: addSignal()

      • DefaultEdfConfig

        public DefaultEdfConfig(int numberOfSignals)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor creates a DefaultEdfConfig instance of the given type (EDF_16BIT or BDF_24BIT) with the given number of channels (signals)
        Parameters:
        numberOfSignals - number of signals in data records
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if numberOfSignals <= 0

      • DefaultEdfConfig

        public DefaultEdfConfig(EdfConfig recordingInfo)
        Constructor to make a copy of the given DefaultEdfConfig instance
        Parameters:
        recordingInfo - DefaultEdfConfig instance that will be copied

      • setRecordingStartDateTime

        public void setRecordingStartDateTime(int year,
                                      int month,
                                      int day,
                                      int hour,
                                      int minute,
                                      int second)
        Sets recording start date and time. If not called, EdfFileWriter will use the system date and time at runtime since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC.
        Parameters:
        year - 1970 - 3000
        month - 1 - 12
        day - 1 - 31
        hour - 0 - 23
        minute - 0 - 59
        second - 0 - 59

        Parameters:

      • setDurationOfDataRecord

        public void setDurationOfDataRecord(double durationOfDataRecord)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets duration of DataRecords (data packages) in seconds. Default value = 1 sec.
        Parameters:
        durationOfDataRecord - duration of DataRecords in seconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if durationOfDataRecord <= 0.

      • setDigitalRange

        public void setDigitalRange(int signalNumber,
                            int digitalMin,
                            int digitalMax)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the digital minimum and maximum values of the signal. Usually it's the extreme output of the ADC.
        -32768 <= digitalMin <= digitalMax <= 32767 (EDF_16BIT file format).
        -8388608 <= digitalMin <= digitalMax <= 8388607 (BDF_24BIT file format).

        Digital min and max must be set for every signal!!!
        Default digitalMin = -32768, digitalMax = 32767 (EDF_16BIT file format)
        Default digitalMin = -8388608, digitalMax = 8388607 (BDF_24BIT file format)

        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal(channel). Numeration starts from 0
        digitalMin - the minimum digital value of the signal
        digitalMax - the maximum digital value of the signal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if digitalMin >= digitalMax,

      • setPhysicalRange

        public void setPhysicalRange(int signalNumber,
                             double physicalMin,
                             double physicalMax)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the physical minimum and maximum values of the signal (the values of the input of the ADC when the output equals the value of "digital minimum" and "digital maximum"). Usually physicalMin = - physicalMax.

        Physical min and max must be set for every signal!!!

        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal(channel). Numeration starts from 0
        physicalMin - the minimum physical value of the signal
        physicalMax - the maximum physical value of the signal
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if physicalMin >= physicalMax

      • setPhysicalDimension

        public void setPhysicalDimension(int signalNumber,
                                 java.lang.String physicalDimension)
        Sets the physical dimension of the signal ("uV", "BPM", "mA", "Degr.", etc.). It is recommended to set physical dimension for every signal.
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal (channel). Numeration starts from 0
        physicalDimension - physical dimension of the signal ("uV", "BPM", "mA", "Degr.", etc.)

      • setTransducer

        public void setTransducer(int signalNumber,
                          java.lang.String transducer)
        Sets the transducer of the signal ("AgAgCl cup electrodes", etc.). This method is optional.
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal (channel). Numeration starts from 0
        transducer - string describing transducer (electrodes) used for measuring

      • setPrefiltering

        public void setPrefiltering(int signalNumber,
                            java.lang.String prefiltering)
        Sets the prefilter of the signal ("HP:0.1Hz", "LP:75Hz N:50Hz", etc.). This method is optional.
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal (channel). Numeration starts from 0
        prefiltering - string describing filters that were applied to the signal

        Parameters:

        label - label of the signal

      • getNumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord

        public int getNumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord(int signalNumber)
        Description copied from class: EdfConfig
        Gets the number of samples belonging to the signal in each DataRecord (data package). See also EdfConfig.getSampleFrequency(int).

        When duration of DataRecords = 1 sec (default): NumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord = sampleFrequency

        Specified by:
        getNumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord in class EdfConfig
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal (channel). Numeration starts from 0
        Returns:
        number of samples belonging to the signal with the given sampleNumberToSignalNumber in each DataRecord (data package)

      • setNumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord

        public void setNumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord(int signalNumber,
                                               int numberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the number of samples belonging to the signal in each DataRecord (data package).

        When duration of DataRecords = 1 sec (default): NumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord = sampleFrequency

        SampleFrequency o NumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord must be set for every signal!!!

        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal(channel). Numeration starts from 0
        numberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord - number of samples belonging to the signal with the given sampleNumberToSignalNumber in each DataRecord
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given numberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord <= 0

      • addSignal

        public void addSignal()
        Add new signal to the inner "signals list".

      • removeSignal

        public void removeSignal(int signalNumber)
        Removes the signal from the inner "signals list".
        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal(channel) to remove. Numeration starts from 0

      • getNumberOfSignals

        public int getNumberOfSignals()
        Description copied from class: EdfConfig
        Return the number of measuring channels (signals).
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfSignals in class EdfConfig
        Returns:
        the number of measuring channels

      • setSampleFrequency

        public void setSampleFrequency(int signalNumber,
                               int sampleFrequency)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the sample frequency of the signal. This method is just a user friendly wrapper of the method setNumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord(int, int)

        When duration of DataRecords = 1 sec (default): NumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord = sampleFrequency

        SampleFrequency o NumberOfSamplesInEachDataRecord must be set for every signal!!!

        Parameters:
        signalNumber - number of the signal(channel). Numeration starts from 0
        sampleFrequency - frequency of the samples (number of samples per second) belonging to that channel
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given sampleFrequency <= 0
